channel.title: Project Notebook #3?
channel.description:
References:
[url=https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?topic=480803.0]Project Notebook[/url] [url=https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,541826.msg3969439.html#msg3969439]Project Notebook #2[/url]
Alright guys,
Quite visibly the activity of the forum has declined since these previous projects and we are left with a much smaller userbase (most of which have invested too much time to leave :)).
I'm wondering if you would be interested in giving this project one more chance. The process in setting up the notebook would be similar to that of the first two, but I'm creating this thread to ask for feedback/opinions on anything that could be improved. Most of the members that are frequently visiting this forum now can be trusted.
If this shows some interest I'll start working on a third thread. Please leave some feedback for me.
This is really not a difficult project. Ship it with tracking within the week you receive it and post a picture of the receipt.

item.title: Project Notebook #3?
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Dang thing never even came close to me either time lol.

Read full topic

item.title: Project Notebook #3?
item.dc:creator: @ox_random_xi ox random xi
item.description:
@ox_random_xi wrote:

[quote=“Muroth, post:106, topic:552256”]i was in the first and i was super excited to see an actual notebook arrive to my home and look at other people’s drawings and sketches, the second one i forgot what happened, i think it didn’t get to me because somebody withheld it or claimed it never came… i say third times the charm[/quote]it was quite fun i was in the second one receiving it is awesome

Read full topic

item.title: Project Notebook #3?
item.dc:creator: @Muroth Muroth
item.description:
@Muroth wrote:

i was in the first and i was super excited to see an actual notebook arrive to my home and look at other people’s drawings and sketches, the second one i forgot what happened, i think it didn’t get to me because somebody withheld it or claimed it never came… i say third times the charm

Read full topic

item.title: Project Notebook #3?
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

Stop this nonsense about sending in submissions, send the notebook around the world or don’t do it at all.

At the end of it we should make a video of a hand flipping through the pages and zooming in on each page from a first person view. Then we should string that son of a bitch to the back of a mopar and drag race.

Read full topic

item.title: Project Notebook #3?
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

I don’t really have a preference on the physical copy, that’s up to you guys. It is just as easy to print physical copies as it is to upload a PDF most likely, but more expensive of course. I believe the greater intention of the physical copy was to make the less trustworthy members have a reason to send it and receive a copy of the completed notebook.

I think that putting the less trustworthy members at the beginning (and being very selective in the participant process) and having the shipping deposit is good enough, but I am still completely open to feedback.

A “digital notebook” is not an option for this project and has no reason to be discussed further, the notebook will remain physical.

Read full topic

item.title: Project Notebook #3?
item.dc:creator: @ox_random_xi ox random xi
item.description:
@ox_random_xi wrote:

[quote=“Justin Bieber, post:101, topic:552256”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=671171.msg4492915#msg4492915 date=1439315570]
What if we do it like this:

Have X deposit fee if you’re just in it to write your name in the book and send it.
Have Y deposit fee if you want a full copy of the book.

Then, after the book makes it back to Chassey, everyone who deposited X will get their money back, and Chassey (I know I’m basically saying “Yeah, he’ll do all the work for sure!”) then could make the copies for each person and send it.

Of course, Chassey would have to agree to this (As would everyone else) but that way everyone that wanted a copy would get a copy.
[/quote]I don’t think there would be much point in requiring a deposit for a physical copy of the book, especially when you’ll need to do all that bitcoin faff. If you want a physical copy, surely it can be agreed at the end and the people interested just send the cost over paypal/bank transfer/etc?

Also, I’m not sure what everyone else thinks but I personally wouldn’t see much value in having a physical copy - I could easily print out the pdf myself. It’s all about the cocaine-lined pages etc[/quote]no yeah the whole point isn’t to just have the book… its the cool art, the raised pages, the weird smells, the cocaine filled cracks, the schizophrenic drawing that someone did on said cocaine… we could never replicate that… I don’t really care for a physical copy sent to me just being apart of it then it can be uploaded as a PDF as to show that the community isn’t complete asshats.

Read full topic

item.title: Project Notebook #3?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Justin Bieber, post:101, topic:552256”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=671171.msg4492915#msg4492915 date=1439315570]
What if we do it like this:

Have X deposit fee if you’re just in it to write your name in the book and send it.
Have Y deposit fee if you want a full copy of the book.

Then, after the book makes it back to Chassey, everyone who deposited X will get their money back, and Chassey (I know I’m basically saying “Yeah, he’ll do all the work for sure!”) then could make the copies for each person and send it.

Of course, Chassey would have to agree to this (As would everyone else) but that way everyone that wanted a copy would get a copy.
[/quote]I don’t think there would be much point in requiring a deposit for a physical copy of the book, especially when you’ll need to do all that bitcoin faff. If you want a physical copy, surely it can be agreed at the end and the people interested just send the cost over paypal/bank transfer/etc?

Also, I’m not sure what everyone else thinks but I personally wouldn’t see much value in having a physical copy - I could easily print out the pdf myself. It’s all about the cocaine-lined pages etc[/quote]
Yes but the only way to get a physical copy with the same “memories” as the original would have, we would have to count how many people are in the project and buy that many notebooks… Then ship all of those around the world to each person.
That’d be like 10+ books that everyone would have to sign…

And when I said deposit for the physical copy, I meant a payment, not so much a deposit that is returned.

Read full topic

item.title: Project Notebook #3?
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:100, topic:552256”]What if we do it like this:

Have X deposit fee if you’re just in it to write your name in the book and send it.
Have Y deposit fee if you want a full copy of the book.

Then, after the book makes it back to Chassey, everyone who deposited X will get their money back, and Chassey (I know I’m basically saying “Yeah, he’ll do all the work for sure!”) then could make the copies for each person and send it.

Of course, Chassey would have to agree to this (As would everyone else) but that way everyone that wanted a copy would get a copy.[/quote]I don’t think there would be much point in requiring a deposit for a physical copy of the book, especially when you’ll need to do all that bitcoin faff. If you want a physical copy, surely it can be agreed at the end and the people interested just send the cost over paypal/bank transfer/etc?

Also, I’m not sure what everyone else thinks but I personally wouldn’t see much value in having a physical copy - I could easily print out the pdf myself. It’s all about the cocaine-lined pages etc

Read full topic

item.title: Project Notebook #3?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

What if we do it like this:

Have X deposit fee if you’re just in it to write your name in the book and send it.
Have Y deposit fee if you want a full copy of the book.

Then, after the book makes it back to Chassey, everyone who deposited X will get their money back, and Chassey (I know I’m basically saying “Yeah, he’ll do all the work for sure!”) then could make the copies for each person and send it.

Of course, Chassey would have to agree to this (As would everyone else) but that way everyone that wanted a copy would get a copy.

item.title: Project Notebook #3?
item.dc:creator: @LilXCj LilXCj
item.description:
@LilXCj wrote:

I’d love to get in on this, I sent the first one as the second didn’t even reach me. Although, I don’t even get onto these forums enough anymore to warrant checking when this actually bears fruit.

Read full topic

item.title: Project Notebook #3?
item.dc:creator: @ox_random_xi ox random xi
item.description:
@ox_random_xi wrote:

[quote=“my-swagger, post:95, topic:552256”]Just make everybody draw on their own A4 or A5 paper and post scanned copies. We can have a thread dedicated to showcasing the work furthermore it is fairly easy to compile it into a book format that anybody can print out if they want a hard copy [size=4pt](or mitb can sell books to make money for the offical server:D).
[/size]
No money, no personal information. Don’t need to worry about the courier losing the notebook either. This method is better then any 1st Class Delivery next day service bs too![/quote]
that’s not the point, and we’ve been over this. and I believe this has been said stated to hell too that we should be old enough to ship shit to each other without someone stealing it

[quote=“Rodgerwilco, post:96, topic:552256”][quote author=ox random xi link=topic=671171.msg4492249#msg4492249 date=1438884599]

I was part of notebook #1 and was lucky enough to be able to receive and send it.

It was a unique experience due to the crazy fudgeing smell, looked like it was covered in drugs and was full of awesome shit. Yes, I want a physical copy. It’s all about it traveling the world.

Add me to the list if we are doing a #3 I am down
[/quote]i hope someone rolls blunts ontop of the notebook… that would be top haha

No, I am pretty confident someone filled some pages with Cocaine.[/quote]now now that would be a waste of money

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Travas Travas
item.description:

doing this digitally defeats the entire purpose of doing this at all.

there needs to be a physical copy that goes from person to person or else it is completely pointless to even do it.

Read full topic

item.title: Project Notebook #3?
item.dc:creator: @my-swagger my-swagger
item.description:
@my-swagger wrote:

Just make everybody draw on their own A4 or A5 paper and post scanned copies. We can have a thread dedicated to showcasing the work furthermore it is fairly easy to compile it into a book format that anybody can print out if they want a hard copy [size=4pt](or mitb can sell books to make money for the offical server:D).
[/size]
No money, no personal information. Don’t need to worry about the courier losing the notebook either. This method is better then any 1st Class Delivery next day service bs too!

Read full topic

item.title: Project Notebook #3?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:87, topic:552256”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=671171.msg4491553#msg4491553 date=1438350815]
Do people actually want/need a physical copy of the notebook? Why not just scan it all to a PDF and put it up for download, if you want a physical copy, print it out yourself?

I have a scanner so I could do that part, but I’m sure plenty others do as well?

As far as an escrow account of sorts goes, if everyone deposits X, then what? I guess we could buy and email pre-paid shipping labels to everyone, but it still doesn’t prevent anyone from ‘stealing’ it.
[/quote]
The point of sending a deposit is that you only get it back if you actually send the notebook, not primarily to distribute the shipping costs.[/quote]

It could work, in that case I propose this:

I’ll give each person who wants to participate a unique bitcoin address to send X to (amount to be decided), and they give me an address at which to refund the amount. Then sending and refunding is easy!

Read full topic
